subject: Travel
title: Carthage: Rome's Erased Rival
description: A quick, practical guide to Carthage: Rome's Erased Rival.

hook.text: Rome hated Carthage so much it burned the city, salted the earth, and erased it from every record.

buildup.text: Carthage was a North African trading empire that rivaled Rome for control of the Mediterranean.

discovery.text: Hannibal's army crossed the Alps with war elephants and nearly destroyed Rome in 218 BC.

twist.text: Rome eventually won and demolished Carthage so completely that archaeologists struggled to find it.

climax.text: Ironically, Rome later rebuilt a Roman city on the same spot. It became one of the empire's richest cities.

punchline.text: Rome destroyed Carthage, then rebuilt it as their own.

quiz.question: Who led Carthage's famous invasion of Italy with war elephants?
